data.title: Au Revoir, Craig Ferguson: Why Is Late Night's Funniest Host Leaving?
data.meta_description: Welcome to the official blog of Jamie Reno, an award-winning journalist and author, cancer survivor, singer-songwriter, and veterans' advocate.
data.text: Jamie Reno, an award-winning correspondent for Newsweek for 23 years, is now a staff investigative reporter for Healthline, America's #1 consumer health news site with 80 million monthly visitors, passing WebMD. Jamie has also written for The New York Times, Rolling Stone, Yahoo Finance, People, Men’s Journal, ESPN, International Business Times, The Daily Beast, Los Angeles Times, Sports Illustrated, MSNBC, Entertainment Weekly and USA Today. Reno, who’s won more than 160 writing and journalism awards, was the lead reporter on a Newsweek series on the 9/11 terrorist attacks that earned him and his colleagues the National Magazine Award for General Excellence. Reno is also a popular author (Hope Begins in the Dark, Snowman on the Pitcher's Mound), award-winning singer-songwriter-guitarist (jamiereno.com), and global advocate for cancer patients, Covid patients, health care workers, war veterans and children. He is a 23-year, three-time stage 4 cancer survivor. He lives in San Diego with his wife, Gabriela, and their daughter, Mandy.
